paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the KCNH2 gene, including penetrance data.

patients.phenotype: Brugada-type ECG and short QT interval

individual_records.phenotype_details: Brugada-type ECG and short QT interval
individual_records.evidence_sentence: In 2009, Itoh et al., as the 'first', identified a mutation (R1135H) in KCNH2 in a 34-year old man with Brugada-type ECG and short QT interval.
Verkerk et al. in 2005, identified two mutations (G873S and N985S) in two unrelated SCN5A-negative BrS patients.
Verkerk et al. in 2005, identified two mutations (G873S and N985S) in two unrelated SCN5A-negative BrS patients.

functional_data.summary: Functional investigation revealed an increase in the rectifying current, namely an increase in peak current during phase 0 and phase 1 of the ventricular AP.

variants.segregation_data: The G873S variant was found in 2 of 500 unrelated Han Chinese controls suggesting that the variant has only a modifying role or is an innocent bystander.
variants.population_frequency: G873S was found in 2 of 500 unrelated Han Chinese controls.
variants.additional_notes: The glycine at position 873 is not conserved between human, mouse and rat.
key_quotes: Functional investigation revealed an increase in the rectifying current, namely an increase in peak current during phase 0 and phase 1 of the ventricular AP.
G873S, however, was found in 2 of 500 unrelated Han Chinese controls suggesting that the variant has only a modifying role or is an innocent bystander.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data for KCNH2 variants were extracted successfully.
